metadata.title: CVE-2023-51794 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
Buffer Overflow vulnerability in Ffmpeg v.N113007-g8d24a28d06 allows alocal attacker to execute arbitrary code via thelibavfilter/af_stereowiden.c:120:69.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-51794` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm5
libavcodec-extra - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm5
libavcodec-extra57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm5
libavcodec57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm5
libavdevice57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm5
libavfilter-extra - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm5
libavfilter-extra6 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm5
libavfilter6 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm5
libavformat57 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm5
libavresample3 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm5
libavutil55 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm5
libpostproc54 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm5
libswresample2 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm5
libswscale4 - 7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm5
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '7:3.4.11-0ubuntu0.1+esm5').
